post: Deadline Alert! Our MyImpact Challenge contest closes tomorrow, May 18 at 11:59 PM! Showcase your impact and win: 🏆 $10,000 Grand Prize 🥇 $7,500 First Prize 🥈 $5,000 Second Prize 🥉 $2,000 Third Prize Students! Apply now –  https://bit.ly/3YCS9wE

Deadline Alert! Our MyImpact Challenge contest closes Sunday, May 18 at 11:59 PM! Showcase your impact and win: 🏆 $10,000 Grand Prize 🥇 $7,500 First Prize 🥈 $5,000 Second Prize 🥉 $2,000 Third Prize Students! Apply now –  https://bit.ly/3YCS9wE

Excited to see our very own Amanda, VP of Business Development at Kalogon, featured in the latest Honoring Service episode from the Bill of Rights Institute. 🎧 Tune in to hear Amandas insights and the powerful stories being shared.

In the latest episode of our Honoring Service YouTube series, BRI's Gerald Gangaram discusses civic virtue and responsibility with former Air Force engineer Amanda Krantz. Krantz has served in a variety of positions in the Air Force, at Lockheed Martin Missiles and Space, and with NASA. Currently she is the Vice President of Finance and Business Development at Kalogon, an engineering and manufacturing company that designs seating for customers like wheelchair users, pilots, and drivers. Krantz has always desired to improve peoples lives with technology. Let her story inspire yours!  https://bit.ly/3Sg5MhL

In 1776, a bold Declaration changed the course of history. Now, 250 years later, its time to bring that historyand the power of civicsto life for students across the nation. The Civic Star Challenge is a nationwide call to K–12 educators to spark meaningful conversations, hands-on learning, and civic action. Imagine classrooms across the nation becoming hubs of meaningful conversations and hands-on engagement, connecting your students directly to 250 years of American history and civic activity. How to participate: 📘 Engage: Use ready-to-go, flexible lesson plans to teach the Declarations timeless themes. 📸 Share: Submit a simple form to spotlight your students activities. 🏆 Win: Earn the chance to win exciting prizes throughout the school year! Sign up now and be the first to hear when the Civic Star Challenge launches in August 2025:  https://lnkd.in/eQsPQWCj
The Bill of Rights Institute is committed to honoring the work that teachers do in their communities throughout the year. Join us as we celebrate teachers this month!

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Abigail Huffman! She is a junior at Forest Hills Eastern High School in Grand Rapids, Michigan. She is actively involved in varsity soccer, Model UN, DECA, Youth in Government, and the district Student Advisory Council. Outside of school, Abigail channels her passion for politics into meaningful work with youth political organizations and proudly represents Michigan as a National Youth Advocate for the YMCA. When not studying or engaged in civic work, she enjoys traveling, camping, and listening to musicespecially Taylor Swift. BRIs Student Fellowship is a six-month educational program that helps high school students develop as leaders and develop skills in building civil society. Learn more about the Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h
